sen.j: 条坊制（じょうぼうせい）とは、中国・朝鮮半島・日本の王城都市に見られる都市プランで、南北中央に朱雀大路を配した。
sen.e: Jobosei was the city plan seen in cities that contained the Emperor's palace in countries such as China, the Korean Penninsula, and Japan; furthermore, the Suzaku-oji Street was placed in the center of the city running from east to west.

sen.j: 南北の大路（条）と東西の大路（坊）を碁盤の目状に組み合わせた左右対称で方形の都市プランである。
sen.e: The Jobosei-type city was built in a symmetrical and square shape and streets were organized so that the Oji (jyo) streets that ran south to north and the Oji (bou) streets that ran east to west were arrenged in a grit pattern.

sen.j: 日本における条坊制の都市には、都であった藤原京・平城京・長岡京・平安京、および、広い地方を統括した太宰府謎・矛盾・多賀城等がある。
sen.e: The Jobosei-type cities in Japan included the Fujiwara Capital, the Heijo Capital, the Nagaoka Capital, the Heian Capital, the Dazaifu and the Taga-jyo Castle which controlled a broad area.
sen.cmt: 謎・矛盾ー意味が通じません。ウィキピーディアには、書かれていませんでした。
sen.e: The Jobosei-type cities in Japan includes capital cities such as Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara), Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara), Nagaoka-kyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka), and Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto), and Dazaifu, Taga-jo Castle and others which controlled a broad area.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「太宰府謎・矛盾・多賀城等」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「大宰府・多賀城等」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: The Jobosei-type cities in Japan includes capital cities such as Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara), Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara), Nagaoka-kyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka), and Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto), and Dazaifu, Taga-jo Castle and others which controlled a broad area.

sen.j: ただし、異民族の侵攻の恐れのある大陸においては、郭城（塀＝羅城をめぐらした城）であるが、島国である日本では城壁は作られず（大宰府には城壁があったとも考えられている)。
sen.e: However, walls were not constructed around the capital cities in Japan because invasion by other races was not considered a threat because Japan was an island (Dazaifu might have been built with walls), although Rajo (a city surrounded by walls) was seen in the continent where invasion by different races was feared.
